# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump::Int=3)
    return dt + Hour(bump)
end

# Throws an error for Date types
timezone_bumper(Date(2022, 1, 1))
```

The `timezone_bumper` function takes a `DateTime` object and an optional `bump` integer as arguments. It adds the `bump` number of hours to the `DateTime` object and returns the new `DateTime` object. If a `Date` object is passed instead of a `DateTime` object, it will throw an error because `Date` objects do not have a time component.
